bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Committee on Industrial and Labor Relations was formed by Joint Resolution of the New York Legislature on 18 March 1938. Under the chairmanship of Assembly Majority Leader, Irving W. Ives, it conducted investigations of, and proposed legislation concerning the arbitration of labor disputes, unemployment compensation, the self regulation on industry, the moving of industry into and out of the State, and profit-sharing as an incentive to better labor relations. By resolution of 26 March 1940, the Committee was renamed the Committee on Industrial and Labor Conditions, and its functions expanded. In 1943, it published The American Story of Industrial and Labor Relations; a short Volume tracing the development of social welfare legislation in industrial and labor relations areas.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a typescript carbon copy of a preliminary draft of The American Story, 1942, entitled Industrial and Labor Relations.
